group_1.narration: <Nanaka's Side>
After that... Christmas had come and gone,@and our days have returned to what they were.
Then a sudden impulse overcame me...@And so I took a train to where Hanna Sarasa@and Mikoto Sena had vanished.
It's surely because of the dream@I awoke from today.

group_1.textRight: Ugh... Nngh...!

group_1.textLeft: D-don't push yourself. You just broke the@suggestion magic.

group_1.textRight: Save your breath.@Where is Hanna Sarasa...?
...What's this?

group_1.textLeft: Judging from that imprint...@It's like someone had been laying here.

group_1.textRight: In the snow?@It looks big enough for two people...

group_1.textLeft: I think that must mean...@You understand, right?
There are footprints leading to this location...
And nothing beyond that.

group_1.textRight: ...This is where it ends, then.

group_1.textLeft: We can't say that for sure...@The snow might have erased their steps.

group_1.textRight: ...You fool.

group_1.narration: From what Nemu was able to confirm@with her book, Mikoto Sena was almost@consumed by the magic of her Uwasa.
As her own magic was drained@and her consciousness overwhelmed,@she lost her memory as well.
In her final moments...though neither could@remember anything of the other...@they still leaned on each other,@like two flowers entwined in bloom...
From the outside, it looks like a miserable end...@But if I imagine things from their perspective...@as much as I loathe them...it somehow feels like@the ideal outcome, given the circumstances...
...As far as the general public knows,@their whereabouts are unknown.@But we know in truth that they will never return.
Because Nemu tore apart their [textBlue:Rumor]'s page.

group_1.textRight: Why would you do that...?

group_1.textLeft: I wanted their story to end here.
Those two have fought more than enough@for each other's existence...

group_1.narration: I didn't understand what she meant at first...@But it's a strange thing.@I don't understand why, but the decision@to destroy the page felt so right to me...

group_1.textCenter: They will be together in memory...forever.
...Alright, that's quite enough.@Won't you come out?

group_1.textRight: Huh?! Y-you knew I was there?

group_1.textLeft: Of course I did.@...Why are you following me?

group_1.textRight: Uh, erm...I was just a little worried...ahaha...

group_1.textLeft: ...I'm fine.
Given time, I'll be fine.

group_1.textRight: I see...

group_1.textLeft: ...It's still so cold here.

group_1.textRight: Um...Nanaka?

group_1.textLeft: Yes?

group_1.textRight: I was just thinking...is the Automatic Purification@System still functioning?
Since Mikoto is gone, I...

group_1.textLeft: Ah yes, no need to worry.
It's continuing to function without any issue.
I actually still have the power to connect space@and time.

group_1.textRight: Mikoto Sena left it behind...?@She could do that?

group_1.textLeft: I had no idea it was possible until Mikoto left...
She extracted only her persona and nothing else.
She was fully capable of taking that power@with her, but she didn't.

group_1.textRight: ...It wasn't that Mikoto Sena lost all hope@for the future.

group_1.textLeft: I'm not sure about that...
It may be that she simply cared for nothing@but Hanna Sarasa.

group_1.textRight: That's not true.
Deep down, I think Mikoto still has hope@somewhere...
...For our future.
So that's what happened...

group_1.textLeft: We used that power to return from the Mirror@World, in fact.
I know for a fact that it exists.

group_1.textRight: You mean...those mirrors that can connect@between realities?

group_1.textLeft: Right. There were no other means of escape.

group_1.textRight: I had no idea...

group_1.textLeft: ...So you really are going to see it, Kako?

group_1.textRight: Yes. I want to see it for myself.
How about you, Nanaka?

group_1.textLeft: I don't know why, but...yes.

group_1.textRight: ...How do you feel about those two, Nanaka?
Have you...forgiven them?

group_1.textLeft: No, I haven't.
I've looked into their upbringing and lives,@and the others have told me their story.
But even so, I'm still angry.
Damn them both.

group_1.textRight: I-I see... Ahaha...

group_1.textLeft: I have no sympathy for them.
I just...feel regret.
...And you, Kako?

group_1.textRight: I-I... Well, I was able to bring things back to@normal with my wish.
And besides, there are good things about being@a Magical Girl, you know?
I was able to find courage...@And I became the person I truly wanted to be.

group_1.textLeft: ...Pfft...

group_1.textRight: Eh? Wh-what's wrong?@Did I say something...?

group_1.textLeft: ...No, you're fine. I apologize, I didn't mean@to do that.
Ah... Do you see that?@That's where they...

group_1.textRight: Huh? There are flowers in bloom...

group_1.textLeft: Eh…?

group_1.textRight: What kind of flower is this?

group_1.narration: ―Nanaka―@...Snowdrops. They bloom as the snow melts...@Right around this time of year.
―Kako―@Come to think of it...I saw these flowers in bloom@in other places along our way here.
―Nanaka―@Really?
―Kako―@Yes, I saw them a few times!
―Kako―@Erm, so...that's where they both vanished, right?
―Kako―@And now two flowers are in bloom...@How sweet.
―Nanaka―@It's...the proof that they were here.
I've thought about them many times since then.@And still to this day I cannot fathom@what was going through their heads.
Why did they run?@Why did they vanish here?@What became of them after that...?
Every time I see this flower,@I'll think of them once again.
Even if everyone else forgets, I will remember.
And I will move forward into tomorrow.
―Kako―@We should get going, Nanaka.
―Nanaka―@Right...
―Nanaka―@...May we meet again.@Someday. Somewhere...
With all and whatever love I can muster@from these damned memories.
